snippet: Calls to extend the tours of security teams that were denied by the State Department largely concerned the embassy in Tripoli — not Benghazi, the site of a lethal attack.
abstract: Embassy security officers warned their State Department superiors of worsening threats from Islamic extremists to American diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya; their requests that teams of military personnel and State Department security guards on duty be kept in service were denied; handling of these requests is now caught up in fiercely partisan debate over whether Obama administration underestimated the terrorist threat in Libya.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: Calls to extend the tours of security teams that were denied by the State Department largely concerned the embassy in Tripoli — not Benghazi, the site of a lethal attack.

headline.main: Focus Was on Tripoli in Requests for Security in Libya
headline.print_headline: Cables Show Requests to State Dept. for Security in Libya Were Focused on Tripoli

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
